title: California Firm Recalls Ground Beef Products Due To Possible E. coli O157:H7 Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, June 22, 2010 -South Gate Meat Co., a South Gate, Calif., establishment, is recalling approximately 35,000 pounds of ground beef products that may be contaminated with E. coli O157:H7, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The products...

establishment.name: South Gate Meat Co.
establishment.address:
9336 Long Beach Blvd. 
  South Gate, CA 90280

impacted_products: 20-, 30- and 40-pound bulk packages of "SOUTH GATE MEAT CO. GROUND BEEF."
30-, 40-, and 50-pound bulk packages of "SOUTH GATE MEAT CO. COARSE GROUND BEEF."
10- and 20-pound packages of "SOUTH GATE MEAT CO. GROUND BEEF PATTIES."
